cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central-south Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central–south Texas coast (around Port O'Connor/Corpus Christi area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-western Gulf Coast from south-central Louisiana westward to the lower Texas Coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions; low (≤ 8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (generally 1–2 ft) and dangerous rip currents possible along southeast Louisiana beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rainfall with isolated higher amounts could fall across coastal southeast Louisiana, producing localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions for vessels transiting lower Mississippi River approaches
